title: BBC Local Live: Greater Manchester on Thursday 15 September 2016 - BBC News
summary: manchester city council chief executive announces retirement .
bury tops a list for complaints about noisy neighbours .
postal workers in greater manchester are joining a national strike .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from greater manchester and east cheshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on friday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .

documents.title: weather : dry but a cooler night
text: it is largely dry but increasingly cloudy this evening .
during the second half of the night , some mostly light outbreaks of rain will spread from the west , but there is a yellow warning for heavy showers and thunderstorms tomorrow .
more on bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: are tiny devices in new grey bins being used to spy on people ?
text: manchester city council say they are not using tiny gadgets to monitor what people are putting into their new grey bins and insist the devices are to combat theft .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: police chase drama in weaste as units bring down fleeing bmw
text: a horde of police cars chased and boxed in a blue bmw being driven by two suspects , while weaste residents watched in shock .
author: Salford Online

documents.title: manchester united players grant dying fan 's final wish
text: a football fan 's final wish came true when four manchester united stars paid him a visit an hour before he died .
patrick lawler , 73 , wanted to meet the players before his death so his family launched an appeal on social media .
granddaughter kayleigh lawler carson posted on sunday : `` i want to get this as a surprise , he 's a massive fan '' .
marcus rashford , jesse lingard , ashley young and timothy fosu-mensah then turned up at mr lawler 's home in wythenshawe before he died on tuesday .

documents.title: cricket : lancashire draw with leaders middlesex
text: middlesex will need to win their final match to secure a first championship title since 1993 after a draw with lancashire .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: car finance firm fined £ 30k after sending 65,000 nuisance texts in four months
text: a manchester-based car finance firm has been hit with a £ 30,000 fine for bombarding people with nuisance texts .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: headlines from greater manchester and east cheshire
text: headlines from greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: warrington council invests in solar in swindon
text: warrington council has signed a deal to invest £ 20m in a solar farm in swindon .
the money , which comes from the council 's cash reserves , is to be invested in the solar park over five years , giving the council a return of £ 500,000 a year for those five years .
warrington council say a review will then take place once the fixed term arrangement comes to an end .

documents.title: salford homeless hostel to become £ 2m youth training centre
text: planning permission has been given to turn a disused hostel in salford into a £ 2m training centre for young people .
petrie court on cromwell road in lower kersal provided accommodation to homeless young people but closed in 2014 because of funding cuts .
now it is to become a training centre for 16 to 25-year-olds , which will also give them somewhere to live while they are studying .

documents.title: warrington wolves supporters urged to chant and clap in tribute to superfan
text: warrington wolves fans are being urged to chant and clap on the 36th minute of tomorrow night 's game with wigan warriors in honour of the club 's `` most devoted fan '' , who recently died at the age of 36 .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: man charged over leigh sexual assault
text: a man has been charged with sexual assault after a woman was attacked in leigh on sunday .
the 22-year-old was walking along rydal street in leigh in the early hours of the morning when she was approached .
a 30-year-old man has been remanded in custody to appear at bolton crown court next month .

documents.title: electric fence batteries found wired up to children 's park railings
text: police are appealing for more information after batteries were discovered at a park in shaw , oldham , which had been used to turn the railings of a children 's play area into an electric fence .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: cricket : lancashire 's haseeb hameed to be named in tour squad
text: lancashire 's 19-year-old opener haseeb hameed is set to be named in england 's squad for their tour to bangladesh when it is announced on friday .
if hameed plays in the first test , he will become only the second teenager to appear in the longer form of the game for england since 1949 .
england play two tests and three one-day internationals in bangladesh , beginning on 7 october .
eoin morgan and alex hales have both opted out of the tour over security concerns .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: are cat cafes good for cats ?
text: manchester 's cat cafe is one of nine in the uk , with more in the planning , but are they actually good for the cats ?
the craze for cat cafes began in taiwan in 1998 then spread to japan and beyond - however , the rspca and the celia hammond animal trust have criticised the phenomenon .
`` cat cafes are not a suitable environment for cats because they are in a confined space with a revolving population of people , '' says nicky trevorrow , behaviour manager at cats protection .
`` they need a stable environment - more so than dogs . ''
but while cat cafe owners agree that some animals are not suited for the cafe lifestyle , they say others feel completely at home .

documents.title: travel : road in whitefield remains closed
text: radcliffe new road in whitefield remains closed between dales lane and the blackburn street , because of emergency repairs at a collapsed manhole .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: 'racist , threatening ' women thrown off manchester-ibiza flight
text: four women were thrown off their manchester-to-ibiza flight after allegedly threatening other passengers and using racist language .
they were scheduled to fly to the balearic island on tuesday on monarch airlines flight zb504 .
but after police were called to manchester airport at about 19:10 bst all were removed from the aircraft and no further action was taken .

documents.title: nurses offer sun safety information
text: shoppers and residents in bury can up sun safety information and other tips at the cancer research uk cancer awareness roadshow .
author: Bury Times
Bury Times

documents.title: transmission back at joy division studio
text: a former manchester recording studio once used by bands such as joy division and the sex pistols has been brought back into use .
the facility , inside the old granada studios building , is being used by a new generation of musicians to make music videos for the internet .
author: Clare Fallon
BBC reporter

documents.title: united fans warned to avoid certain areas in rotterdam
text: manchester united fans are being warned to keep a low profile before and after their europa league game against the dutch side feyenoord tonight .
about 1,400 reds supporters are expected to travel to the match in rotterdam .
the club has written a letter to those fans , advising them to dress conservatively and to avoid areas of potential conflict .

documents.title: noisy neighbours : how did your area compare ?
text: the worst places for noisy neighbours in greater manchester have been named with bury topping the list for complaints .
there were more than 11,000 complaints in greater manchester last year - stockport was the quietest area with fewest complaints .

documents.title: blue star simon webbe joins river city drama
text: singer and actor simon webbe , from the boy band blue , is joining scottish drama river city , bbc scotland has confirmed .
webbe , from moss side , will be arriving in shieldinch this autumn .
the bbc said webbe had filmed his first river city scenes this week as the new character andy - a former army man .
he will be joined on the soap by salford 's rebecca atkinson , best known for her role in the channel 4 drama , shameless .

documents.title: rogue firework trader stored explosives without licence or safety measures
text: a rogue firework trader caused a great risk to the general public when he stored boxes full of explosives without a licence and without any safety measures .
author: Manchester Evening News
Manchester Evening News

documents.title: plans for eruv in hale withdrawn
text: plans to create an eruv in hale in greater manchester have been withdrawn , after trafford council received more than 500 objections .
the symbolic boundary would allow members of the orthodox jewish community to do some of the things normally banned on the sabbath .
the plan included using wires mounted on top of poles where the boundary crossed roads .

documents.title: weather : rain for the weekend
text: there is a yellow warning for rain tomorrow , so make sure you enjoy some sunshine today .
enjoy the weather today - the met office has issued a yellow warning for rain tomorrow !

documents.title: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire
text: latest headlines for greater manchester and east cheshire

documents.title: football : rooney omitted from man utd squad
text: striker wayne rooney has been left out of manchester united 's 20-man squad for thursday 's europa league tie in rotterdam against dutch side feyenoord .
despite training on wednesday , the 30-year-old captain will miss the club 's european opener , as will luke shaw , antonio valencia and jesse lingard .
manager jose mourinho said rooney had been rested in advance of sunday 's premier league trip to watford .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: councillor slams council over flooding
text: councillor andy kelly has slammed the council for `` ignoring residents and businesses plight '' after heavy rainfall left parts of milnrow and newhey under water again .
author: Rochdale Online

documents.title: sir howard bernstein : outgoing chief executive 's major projects
text: chief executive of manchester city council , sir howard bernstein , has announced he 's stepping down next year .
here are some of the major projects he has been involved in :

documents.title: cricket : play resumes in lancashire 's county championship match
text: lancashire are bowling for victory today .
a win for the red rose would effectively secure their division one status .
follow ball-by-ball commentary online .
play starting on time today at 10.30am but the floodlights are needed due to early morning mist .
# lanvmid

documents.title: the fishy ingredient in beer that bothers vegetarians
text: many people may not realise the beer in their pint glass contains a product made from fish .
now the campaign for real ale is calling on brewers to remove it from their drinks .

manchester 's marble brewery is one of a handful to be approved by the vegetarian society , and while not averse to using odd ingredients - from japanese citrus fruit yuzu to bergamot - the idea of filling a pint full of fish bladders left a bad taste .
we 'd lose a lot of customers if we were n't part of it .
we always try and make our beers as clear as they can be through great brewing - it 's a source of pride for us
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: wheelchair basketball coach hopes to inspire in cheshire
text: as elite disability athletes compete in rio at the paralympic games , wheelchair basketball player anna jackson has said she hopes to inspire others by coaching cheshire phoenix .

jackson , who played for great britain for 10 years , told the english federation of disability sport that wheels gave her back her `` freedom and independence '' , adding `` suddenly life was amazing again .
life became so much better once i discovered what a set of wheels could do for me . ''
the beauty of this sport is that you 're part of something and it does n't matter what 's wrong with you or what does n't work - it 's about sport and that positive environment

documents.title: sir howard bernstein : proud to serve 'premier league world city '
text: the chief executive of manchester city council , sir howard bernstein , said it has been `` a privilege '' to serve the city during such `` a pivotal period '' , as he announces he is stepping down from his post next year .
sir howard will have been at the council 46 years next year , having joined as a junior clerk in 1971 .

he said manchester was `` firmly established as a confident and dynamic place , recognised as a premier league world city '' but he added there were `` significant challenges to address to ensure everyone who live here has the opportunity to share in , and contribute to , its growing success '' .

documents.title: weather : weather warning issued by met office
text: a yellow severe weather warning for # rain has been issued : stay # weatheraware @ twitterid
your forecast for tomorrow says sunny and then light rain but you 've issued a severe weather warning for the area ?
hi , a national severe weather warning for your area or region supersedes a standard forecast .
we welcome feedback 1/2
yellow do n't mean squat
@ twitterid @ twitterid purple alert !
ooooo does this mean that the gosport/portsmouth area may actually see some thunder and lightning tomorrow ?
guess i 'll be taking my raincoat to work tomorrow then !

documents.title: rugby league : leigh 's journey from despair to delight
text: leigh 's return to super league after an 11-year absence is a classic tale of success being achieved after overcoming adversity .

their championship opponents might not agree , having seen the centurions lift the past three league titles , and lose just three games in that time - not to mention an outlay on players few , if any , of them could match .
how have leigh turned it around after hitting rock bottom just seven years ago ?
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bury has the noisiest neighbours , complaints research finds
text: bury has topped a list for complaints about noisy neighbours .
it has been put together by a company which makes noise monitoring equipment from freedom of information requests to local councils in greater manchester .
there were more than 11,000 complaints in greater manchester last year - stockport was the quietest area with fewest complaints .

documents.title: sir howard bernstein to step down from manchester city council
text: the man who 's widely credited with rebuilding manchester after the ira bomb has announced he is to retire from his post as chief executive of manchester city council next spring .
sir howard bernstein has been with the council since starting as a junior clerk in 1971 and has held his current post since 1998 .

during his time in charge , the city has hosted the commonwealth games in 2002 , launched the manchester international festival and seen the devolution of powers from central government to the wider area .

documents.title: man and dog attacked in leigh
text: masked men armed with a machete raided a home and attacked a man and a dog in leigh , police said .
three men , who spoke with liverpool accents , forced their way into a home on sherwood grove on 9 september and asked for money before assaulting them and running off .
police are appealing for information , saying the victim had been `` extremely shaken '' and the dog was `` traumatised '' .

documents.title: post office workers staging 24-hour strike
text: thousands of post office workers are expected to go on strike later in a dispute over branch closures , job losses and changes to pensions .
the communication workers union says 18 post offices across greater manchester will be affected by the 24-hour walkout .
the industrial action which is also being staged by unite union members is expected to have the most impact on 300 crown post offices in town and city centres .
the post office said most of its 11,600 branches would remain open and it would work to minimise disruption .

documents.title: travel : m602 crash causes delays
text: one lane is closed on the entry slip road on the m602 and very slow traffic eastbound at junction 1 , the eccles interchange , because of a crash involving a motorbike and several cars .
there is congestion on the m62 to junction 10 , the croft interchange .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : warm day after fog clears
text: a misty or foggy start for some this morning .
this will gradually lift and clear to leave another warm afternoon with sunny spells developing for many .
more from bbc weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: welcome to greater manchester live on a misty morning .
we 're here until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across the 10 boroughs and east cheshire .
you can get in touch with all your comments , photographs and news by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Rachael Connors
Reporter, BBC News Online
